alert.note: Alert for El Paso (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 22 at 2:24PM MST until February 22 at 3:00PM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northwestern El Paso County in east central Colorado... * Until 300 PM MST. * At 222 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located from near Monument to Colorado Springs, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 20 mph. The heaviest snow was falling around the Air Force Academy. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. I-25 will be impacted from Monument to Colorado Springs. Locations impacted include... Colorado Springs, Monument, Air Force Academy, Manitou Springs, Black Forest, Gleneagle, Cimarron Hills, Cascade and Chipita Park. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
